subject: Re: [junit] junitx: access levels
msgSnippet: I agree completely. It wasn t me who posed the original question - I was just outlining why you might have private constructors. A+ ... [Non-text portions of
messageBody:
I agree completely. It wasn't me who posed the original question - I was
just outlining why you might have private constructors.

A+

On 30/08/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> David wrote:
>
> >The constructor would be private if is a singleton class i.e only one
> >instance is created and you use a static getInstance() method to get that
>
> >instance.
> >
> >
> But why can't your test use the getInstance method()?
>
>
> ------------------------------
